content: The following lists events that happened during **(/wiki/1950) in the [Colony of Singapore](/wiki/Colony_of_Singapore)**. ## Incumbents - [Governor](/wiki/List_of_Governors_of_Singapore): Sir [Franklin Charles Gimson](/wiki/Franklin_Gimson) - [Colonial Secretary](/wiki/List_of_Chief_Secretaries_of_Singapore): - Sir [Patrick McKerron](/wiki/Patrick_McKerron) (till 29 April) - [Wilfred Lawson Blythe](/wiki/Wilfred_Lawson_Blythe) (starting 30 June) ## Events ### February - 4 February – The [Chung Khiaw Bank](/wiki/Chung_Khiaw_Bank) is founded. ### March - 1 March – The Teachers’ Training College (present-day [National Institute of Education](/wiki/National_Institute_of_Education)) is formed to train teachers. It is the first-ever training college for teachers. - 6 March – A new [postal district](/wiki/Postal_codes_in_Singapore) system dividing Singapore into 28 districts is launched, making it the first ever system. ### April - The [Salmon's Maternity Home](/wiki/Salmon%27s_Maternity_Home) is opened. ### July - 3 July – The [Singapore Tiger Standard](/wiki/Singapore_Tiger_Standard) was founded by millionaire [Aw Boon Haw](/wiki/Aw_Boon_Haw). ### December - 2 December – The [1950 Singapore Municipal Commission election](/wiki/1950_Singapore_Municipal_Commission_election) is held. - 11–13 December – The [Maria Hertogh riots](/wiki/Maria_Hertogh_riots) took place a few days after the verdict, worsened by inflammatory news coverage. The riots left eighteen people dead and 173 injured. ### Dates unknown - [Changi Cottage](/wiki/Changi_Cottage) is built. - The [Grace Assembly of God](/wiki/Grace_Assembly_of_God) is founded. ## Births - 4 February – [Jufrie Mahmood](/wiki/Jufrie_Mahmood), prominent opposition political figure. - 17 February – [Yu-Foo Yee Shoon](/wiki/Yu-Foo_Yee_Shoon), former politician. - 5 March – [Chay Wai Chuen](/wiki/Chay_Wai_Chuen), diplomat and former politician. - 11 March – [Rita Chao](/wiki/Rita_Chao), former singer and actress (d. (/wiki/2014_in_Singapore)). - 20 March – [Mohamed Latiff Mohamed](/wiki/Mohamed_Latiff_Mohamed), Malay poet and writer (d. (/wiki/2022_in_Singapore)). - 22 April – [Seng Han Thong](/wiki/Seng_Han_Thong), former politician. - 30 June – [Kwek Siew Jin](/wiki/Kwek_Siew_Jin), former civil servant and former [rear-admiral](/wiki/Rear-admiral) who served as [Chief of Navy](/wiki/Chief_of_Navy_(Singapore)) from 1992 to 1996. - 4 October – [Claire Chiang](/wiki/Claire_Chiang), entrepreneur, activist and former [Nominated Member of Parliament](/wiki/Nominated_Member_of_Parliament). ## Deaths - May 25 – Yong Yit Lin, former President of the [Singapore Chinese Chamber of Commerce](/wiki/Singapore_Chinese_Chamber_of_Commerce_and_Industry) (b. 1897). - [List of years in Singapore](/wiki/List_of_years_in_Singapore) This Singapore-related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e This year in Asia article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: 1950 in Singapore
